POLICY_COMMENTS: AlternateErrorPagesEnabled (privacy) - disables alternate error pages
AudioSandboxEnabled (security) - enables sandboxing of the audio process
AuthSchemes (security) - restricts to more secure authentication schemes
AutofillCreditCardEnabled (security) - disables credit card autofill
BackgroundModeEnabled (annoyance performance privacy) - disables background mode
BlockExternalExtensions (security) - prevents installing extensions outside the webstore
BlockThirdPartyCookies (privacy) - blocks third-party cookies by default
BrowserLabsEnabled (annoyance) - UI bloat and experimental garbage no-one needs
BrowserSignin (privacy annoyance) - overrides default value, disables account services
ChromeVariations (privacy) - prevents Chromium from overriding features remotely
ClearBrowsingDataOnExitList (privacy ~security) - data specified will be cleared when the 'exit' button is pressed, this is mainly useless data that just wastes space or has privacy implication
ClickToCallEnabled (privacy) - disables phone number sharing for Chromium browser across devices
CloudPrintProxyEnabled (privacy) - disables sharing printers with Google
DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled (annoyance) - default browser checking is so useless

DefaultJavaScriptJitSetting (security) - Chromium changed V8's behavior so that it overrides the '--jitless' flag when this is disabled (set to 2) and changed it so that ONLY JavaScript JIT is disabled not WASM (not used to allow users to enable WASM on sites that need it, but know that disabling V8 Optimizations will enable WASM, set this to 1 to lock disable WASM as well)
DefaultSensorsSetting (privacy security) - overrides default value, disables Sensors access
DesktopSharingHubEnabled (annoyance) - removes the sharing hub
DnsOverHttpsMode (privacy ~security) - enables opportunistic DoH
EnableMediaRouter (privacy) - disables Chrome Cast

ExtensionSettings (security ~annoyance) - block all extensions and extension types but allow uBlock Origin Lite, sets the update source to a trusted location and whitelists the currently used permissions
GenAiDefaultSettings (privacy annoyance) - disables all AI features
GoogleSearchSidePanelEnabled (privacy) - removes side panel searching with Google
HistoryClustersVisible (annoyance) - disables history clusters
HttpsOnlyMode (security) - overrides default value, enables Https Only mode
MetricsReportingEnabled (privacy) - disables telemetry and all kinds of other methods and types of reporting
NativeMessagingBlocklist (security) - prevents extensions from contacting native applications
NetworkServiceSandboxEnabled (security) - enables sandboxing of the network process
PaymentMethodQueryEnabled (privacy ~security) - overrides default value, prevents use of payment provider
PrivacySandboxPromptEnabled (annoyance privacy) - disables Privacy Sandbox features
PrivateNetworkAccessRestrictionsEnabled (security) - enables restrictions on private network access
PromotionsEnabled (privacy annoyance) - disables promotional content
PromptForDownloadLocation (security) - overrides default value, disables auto-download
RelatedWebsiteSetsEnabled (privacy) - overrides default value, disables shared cookie sets, relates to Privacy Sandbox
RemoteAccessHostAllowRemoteAccessConnections (security privacy) - why is there remote access in a browser?
RemoteAccessHostAllowRemoteSupportConnections (security privacy) - again why?
RemoteAccessHostFirewallTraversal (security privacy) - disables firewall awareness for remote access connections
RemoteDebuggingAllowed (security) - seems risky to have enabled for non-debugging purposes
SafeBrowsingDeepScanningEnabled (privacy -security) - disables sending downloads to Google for safe browsing analysis
SafeBrowsingProxiedRealTimeChecksAllowed (privacy -security) - sacrifice minor security in favor of not sending websites to Google for Safe Browsing
SearchSuggestEnabled (privacy) - disables search suggestions
SharedClipboardEnabled (privacy) - disables sharing clipboard across devices
ShowFullUrlsInAddressBar (security annoyance) - no idea why they hide information in the URL bar
WebRtcIPHandling (privacy) - hides IP address for WebRTC
WebRtcTextLogCollectionAllowed (privacy) - disables WebRTC log reporting to Google
